d945c292-2aec-4b48-b0bc-69f03d8b0e32.description: The earner of this badge has examined online learning and instruction in the context of key aspects of adaptation necessary for the online environment. The earner is able to collaborate with others and apply skills of analysis to online course design elements and technologies.

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge has examined online learning and instruction in the context of key aspects of adaptation necessary for the online environment. This earner is able to outline instructional objectives, strategies that align with those objectives and effective assessments.

e8ff71b8-f184-49d0-bca2-5877bd4107eb.description: The earner of this certificate understands course design, instruction, and other issues related to online teaching and learning. This person is able to distinguish the roles of faculty and students in online courses, and recognizes the many methods and importance of communications within a course. They are able to leverage the collaborative nature of online learning along with technology tools. Finally, this earner can design meaningful activities and align them to outcomes and assessments.
e8ff71b8-f184-49d0-bca2-5877bd4107eb.name: Master Online Teacher Certificate

The individual has knowledge of economical, technological, and pedagogical pros and cons of technologies.

12d97542-3952-4c0e-8744-d86b20dc2354.description: The earner of this certificate is an online leader, aspiring leader, or administrator specifically providing leadership to online programs. They can apply researched best practices and practical insights from recognized leaders.

23dc5592-8fb5-4229-9078-e701ba9d17a1.description: This course provides an overview and insights into the key issues of Open Educational Resources. Participants engage with peers by exploring, evaluating, and identifying resources. The student and instructor interactions are designed to benefit the students, teaching, and leadership experiences in understanding the use of OERs.
23dc5592-8fb5-4229-9078-e701ba9d17a1.name: Foundations of Open Educational Resources

issuer.summary: issued by University of Illinois Springfield

badge_template_activities.title: Students will learn: Assessment of OERS; Describe advantages and disadvantages of OER used in higher education settings; Develop an individual learning plan; Use an OER repository to find OER resources to support instruction; Evaluate OER for appropriateness and quality; Create a strategy for using OER in the classroom; Identify a potential open textbook for use in a higher-education classroom or program; Evaluate the open textbook using specific assessment

skills.name: Develop OER Stragegies for classrooms and students

86926f38-62ad-4fba-bbed-e3dc2c4d414b.description: The recipient of this badge participated in the Leadership Lived Program at the University of Illinois Springfield and has demonstrated exemplary qualities in specific leadership areas: Teaching-focused Academic Experience, Collaboration, Public Service, Community Engagement and Leadership.
86926f38-62ad-4fba-bbed-e3dc2c4d414b.name: Leadership Lived Core Achievement Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Student has demonstrated connections between in-class experiences and work, job knowledge, skill development/enhancement, organizational skills, technical knowledge, application of theory, and career development.
Student has demonstrated making connections to others, teamwork, team building, communication, presentation skills, representative of the department/program, and networking.
Student has demonstrated customer service, inclusion, technological development, providing quality work, following policies and guidelines, diversity, self-awareness, and cultural awareness.
Student has demonstrated problem-solving, interpersonal communication, leadership, delegation, time management, dependability, initiative, personal growth, and engaged citizenship.

f54c2786-95b3-4597-80f9-b3fdbc63f1f0.description: The earner of this badge has foundational knowledge on how to use of Open Educational Resources, can define and describe various types of OER to stakeholders, explain the role of OER in K12 education, and discuss the benefits and drawbacks for incorporating OER into the K12 environment, using current research in the field as evidence.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Open Educational Resources in the K-12 Classroom with 80% mastery or higher.

36686e9d-dbbe-4723-8a44-898870ba0ba7.description: The earner of this badge is aware of quality assurance strategies and issues in online programs. This individual is able to work with processes, philosophies, and strategies to build appropriate accountability processes toward the successful accreditation of online degrees and integrate of online programs into the mainstream institutional catalog. The earner recognizes institutional, state, national, and global policies that demand greater accountability and regulatory compliance.
36686e9d-dbbe-4723-8a44-898870ba0ba7.name: Quality Assurance for Online Leaders

issuer.summary: issued by University of Illinois Springfield

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Quality Assurance for Online Leaders with 80% mastery or higher.

c846b00e-49b8-4906-9cbc-97808b19b4aa.description: This course is focused on the application of Open Educational Resources in online learning. Participants develop new, remix, reuse or redistribute an OER for the online setting. The participants will walk through this process step by step with their instructor and collaborate with peers to evaluate OER for student and classroom needs.
c846b00e-49b8-4906-9cbc-97808b19b4aa.name: Creating & Sharing Open Educational Resources for Online Learning

issuer.summary: issued by University of Illinois Springfield

badge_template_activities.title: At the end of the course, a participant should be able to: Describe current knowledge and use of OER in course content Describe ideas for remixing and creating new OER content based on instructional and student needs Use OER repositories and other sources to find OER resources to remix for a specific course Evaluate and select OER to remix Remix OER to create a new OER Select a Creative Commons license for the remixed content Provide proper attribution for remixed content

skills.name: Adapt OER material to classroom and student needs
Evaluate and use Open Education Resources

3d691cf1-f55a-4576-b777-8e63460d34ce.description: The earner of this badge is aware of best practices in the topics of support staff expertise, personal compensation and recognition. This earner is able to discuss tools for online faculty development, implement new technology, and foster accountability within the framework of current guidelines, regulations, and laws.
3d691cf1-f55a-4576-b777-8e63460d34ce.name: Faculty Support for Online Leaders

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Faculty Support for Online Leaders with 80% or higher mastery.

3c4a9e46-0b9a-4480-8c5f-28eae1415797.description: The earner of this badge has foundational knowledge on understanding the gifted learner. This student has examined myths surrounding gifted education, have knowledge of current issues, state policy, resources, and equity and be able to design a comprehensive gifted education plan.
3c4a9e46-0b9a-4480-8c5f-28eae1415797.name: Knowing the Gifted Learner

issuer.summary: issued by University of Illinois Springfield

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Knowing the Gifted Learner with 80% or higher mastery.

d1520974-0387-4815-a68f-ef919082e809.description: The earner of this badge is able to holistically support online students through a high touch/high-tech approach. The earner recognizes the scope of online student services and the importance of developing effective remotely delivered services to improve student success and retention rates. This earner can implement best practices throughout the learner's experience with the institution.
d1520974-0387-4815-a68f-ef919082e809.name: Student Support for Online Leaders

issuer.summary: issued by University of Illinois Springfield

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Student Support for Online Leaders with 80% mastery or higher.

31b50cf8-1ed8-403c-abaa-49114c03fc72.description: This course provides participants with the theory of cultural responsiveness • Provide participants with some techniques behind cultural responsiveness. • Provide participants with experience using diversity, equity, and inclusion techniques through course activities. • Provide an environment where participants can share ideas and experiences related to implicit and explicit bias. • Provide experience in online education from a student’s perspective.
31b50cf8-1ed8-403c-abaa-49114c03fc72.name: Cultural Responsiveness in the Online Classroom

issuer.summary: issued by University of Illinois Springfield

badge_template_activities.title: As a result of completing course activities and interacting in discussion forums, learners will be able to: •  Identify some facilitator strategies for building community and fostering participation in our online courses. •  Identify some benefits and challenges of introducing, identifying, and addressing implicit bias. •  Identify some strategies for making assignments and classroom environment equitable to all students. •  Experience multiple perspectives of diversity, equity, and inclusion.

0d42f384-0890-4f09-92cf-a6dbb01e4fa4.description: The earner of this badge is able to use the Splunk Platform to leverage data analytics, specifically as they relate to student learning. This course is led and facilitated by bitsIO, Inc. bitsIO is a leading Splunk Elite Partner based in Springfield, Illinois.
0d42f384-0890-4f09-92cf-a6dbb01e4fa4.name: Data Analytics using the Splunk Platform

issuer.summary: issued by University of Illinois Springfield

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Splunk Fundamentals, Part 1 course with 80% or higher mastery.

2ed07b86-20ee-42a7-9879-8736a7a9f2cd.description: Students have completed core courses in Foundations of Open Education Resources, how to use OER with student instruction and how to create and share OER materials. Additionally, students have completed a supplementary course in Universal or Instructional Design to round out their knowledge and skills.
2ed07b86-20ee-42a7-9879-8736a7a9f2cd.name: Open Educational Resources for Online Learning Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by University of Illinois Springfield

badge_template_activities.title: Students has successfully completed courses to show mastery of OER concepts: Using resources, creating and sharing OER materials and resources, exploring repositories, determining and selecting OER textbooks, and understanding best practices in the field.

skills.name: Best Practice Knowledge in OER Practice

44f9af9c-4ff8-4d25-8fb1-a6d851a97a49.description: Gifted students have learned basic concepts (physics and math) of quantum computing and why it holds the promise of radically reshaping the world. Topics learned include: basics of quantum mechanics, qubits and quantum information theory and basic quantum algorithms.
44f9af9c-4ff8-4d25-8fb1-a6d851a97a49.name: Quantum Computing for Gifted Learners

issuer.summary: issued by University of Illinois Springfield

badge_template_activities.title: Students demonstrated knowledge of basic of quantum mechanics, basics of qubits and quantum information theory and quantum algorithms.

4029ceaf-44eb-40e0-bc1b-7779b0040e2c.description: The purpose of the course is for participants to plan for and incorporate Open Educational Resources into their classrooms. Participants discuss topics and research related to the adoption of OER in the higher-education classroom.
4029ceaf-44eb-40e0-bc1b-7779b0040e2c.name: Open Education Resources to Support Instruction

issuer.summary: issued by University of Illinois Springfield

badge_template_activities.title: Participants will learn: Ideas for designing or redesigning a unit of instruction by integrating OER; Use OER repositories, OER collections, and online advanced searches to find OER resources for a specific course; Identify and evaluate OER for possible adoption or adaption in the course using specific criteria and standards; Discuss the topics and research on the impact of OER adoption in higher-education classrooms. Learn current practices to increase the use of OER and develop and implement

skills.name: Familiar with OER reserach and current precatice
Identify and evaluate OER for possible adoption
Use OER repositories and Digital collections

d2540515-5df6-47d8-a6ac-8f4a856741e7.description: The earner of this badge is able to use the Splunk Platform to leverage data analytics, specifically as they relate to student learning, big data and data analytics. This course is led and facilitated by bitsIO, Inc. bitsIO is a leading Splunk Elite Partner based in Springfield, Illinois. Splunk is a leading big data platform that provides a unified way to organize and extract real-time insights from massive amounts of machine data from virtually any source.
d2540515-5df6-47d8-a6ac-8f4a856741e7.name: Data Analytics using the Splunk Platform Fundamentals II

issuer.summary: issued by University of Illinois Springfield

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Splunk Fundamentals, Part II course with 80% or higher mastery.

d7324b1b-89a4-424e-9b74-c521e2fb6952.description: Student gained understanding of the framework of behavioral economics and learned how to apply it. Student also learned how to help best motivate individuals to act according to their long-term goals.
d7324b1b-89a4-424e-9b74-c521e2fb6952.name: Addiction and Self Control Workshop

issuer.summary: issued by University of Illinois Springfield

badge_template_activities.title: Student explains why people engage in behavior knowing that is harmful to them; demonstrates basic understanding of the nature of addiction;  describes the role of emotions in decision-making;  describes motivational factors that influence our vulnerability for impulsive behavior; explains why it is so difficult for individuals to follow through on their plans and goals and describes the principles of self-control.

skills.name: Understands Motivational Factors For Impulsive Behavior

ff3db36d-7294-426d-9ab2-96fd7c654a60.description: IBM’s SPSS Statistics software is a powerful data analytics tool used in a variety of industries and academic fields. This workshop is designed for academic and industry researchers, or anyone interested in gaining a foundational, working knowledge of SPSS and provide the ability to conduct data management analysis using descriptive statistics; t-tests; ANOVA, correlations; and the essentials of linear regression).
ff3db36d-7294-426d-9ab2-96fd7c654a60.name: Basics of SPSS Data Management & Analysis

issuer.summary: issued by University of Illinois Springfield

badge_template_activities.title: Through these sessions, attendees will understand:  • The basics of data management in SPSS • The most commonly used analysis techniques (i.e., descriptive statistics; t-tests; ANOVA, correlations; and the essentials of linear regression) in SPSS.

ecef02b5-65a4-4e7d-b7ca-45f9f36856d4.description: The earner of this badge has a perspective on international education and eLearning. This individual is able to work effectively with international students in traditional or online courses, and is prepared to offer international eLearning or training within or outside of the context of their institution and country.
ecef02b5-65a4-4e7d-b7ca-45f9f36856d4.name: Global eLearning

issuer.summary: issued by University of Illinois Springfield

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Global eLearning with 80% or higher mastery.

33a34f8e-11f7-4422-9bde-44f5741dcfdc.description: This workshop is intended for talented middle school students who are interested in advanced mathematical problems. Topics of workshop: Fibonacci numbers, a taste of calculus and the art of estimation.
33a34f8e-11f7-4422-9bde-44f5741dcfdc.name: Math Challenge: Cool math for middle school students

issuer.summary: issued by University of Illinois Springfield

badge_template_activities.title: Students attend all sessions of workshop and complete required activities.

skills.name: Basic calculus and the art of estimation

ec13c29a-7ef9-4a78-b942-5709097786a0.description: This 3-day summer camp was intended for talented high school students with a strong interest in physical science. Students learned the fascinating physics and math behind Einstein's theory of Relativity Concepts covered: * Time Dilation and Length Contraction * The famous E = mc^2 (HC: the 2 is a square) * A glimpse of General Relativity and the mystery of black holes
ec13c29a-7ef9-4a78-b942-5709097786a0.name: Relativity: The physics and math behind Einstein's theory

issuer.summary: issued by University of Illinois Springfield

badge_template_activities.title: Students attended workshop for 6 hours and completed all required activities.

a8a6f63e-e275-4121-92bf-5f608a0f67ca.description: Students gain appreciation for the importance of mathematics discussions and learn Five Practices for Orchestrating Productive Whole-Class Discussions. Workshop focuses on the critical, but sometimes overlooked, practice of selecting strategies for discussions. Using student work, participants will explore these practices with elementary fraction content. Participants will receive knowledge of importance of being purposeful when selecting strategies to promote productive whole class discussions.
a8a6f63e-e275-4121-92bf-5f608a0f67ca.name: Selecting Strategies for Whole Class Discussions

issuer.summary: issued by University of Illinois Springfield

badge_template_activities.title: Participants learn about the importance of being purposeful when selecting strategies to promote productive whole-class discussions. A framework will be presented for participants to learn broad categories of considerations for selecting strategies in-the-moment and detailed sub-categories for further refinement when selecting strategies to move toward a mathematical goal. Participants demonstrate practices of selecting appropriate student work according to framework for class discussions.

skills.name: Knowledge Of Five Practices For Orchestrating Productive Whole-Class Discussions Framework

a3658e7d-c64f-4541-b471-10b243a149ef.description: Student learned concepts regarding positive education and makes the case for why skills that increase positive emotion, engagement, relationships, meaning, and accomplishment should be taught in school. Student learned research-based strategies that increase educator and student well-being will be discussed, as well as the application of these strategies during times of remote instruction for implementation in classroom.
a3658e7d-c64f-4541-b471-10b243a149ef.name: Strategies to Enhance Educator and Student Well-Being

issuer.summary: issued by University of Illinois Springfield

badge_template_activities.title: Participant will describe the purpose of positive education and apply research-based strategies to improve educator and student well-being.

skills.name: Knowledge Of Positive Classroom Communication Strategies

24c34ca0-8ebd-4928-a6ae-4a0576d1b871.description: The UIS Startup Academy is a week-long, summer day academy for High Students demonstrate a desire to foster entrepreneurial spirit, acquire business knowledge, and technological skills. Students learn about the challenges and rewards of starting their own ventures and develop connections with the business and community leaders.
24c34ca0-8ebd-4928-a6ae-4a0576d1b871.name: The Startup Academy - Raising Entrepreneurial Aspirations

issuer.summary: issued by University of Illinois Springfield

badge_template_activities.title: Student attended 5-day workshop at University of Illinois Springfield.

skills.name: Apply knowledge and skills related to entrepreneurialship

7c5d5ab3-5faa-49a9-8f8d-723e7d8e50d6.description: Earners of the UIS Center for Faculty Excellence Course Design badge have demonstrated a strong understanding of university level course design. They have used backward design principles to frame a course based on desired outcomes. They have constructed course materials that integrate effective and measurable learning outcomes. They have developed authentic student assessments that engage students with tasks that authentically reflect job tasks.
7c5d5ab3-5faa-49a9-8f8d-723e7d8e50d6.name: UIS Center for Faculty Excellence Course Design Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by University of Illinois Springfield

badge_template_activities.title: After completion of this course, students will show mastery by completing a syllabus design template, creating a set of measurable learning outcomes for a course, create authentic assessments for a course, analyze a course using Universal Design tools, address relevant course issues and write a summary reflection on growth related to the course topics.

f48d6fa9-1f04-48e8-8cae-67c420a86d3d.description: High School students will investigate a crime scene utilizing the Residential Simulation Lab at UIS. The Criminology, Chemistry and Child Advocacy Studies programs will collaborate to create an experiential crime scene, utilizing interviewing skills and problem-based learning.
f48d6fa9-1f04-48e8-8cae-67c420a86d3d.name: UIS - CSI Crime Scene Institute

issuer.summary: issued by University of Illinois Springfield

badge_template_activities.title: High School students participate in crime scene investigation and collaborate to utilize interviewing skills and problem-based learning.
